exercise.title: HTML Manipulation

p.i: In this exercise, you change the content of an HTML element when the user clicks a button

exercise.p:
Add a new button tag to your HTML document. The button tag should be inside element below the button. The id of the element should be "feedback". In your JavaScript code, write a function called pressed(). When the function is called it should set the text "THANKS:)" to the

element. HINT: The following statement writes "Hello, dude!" inside an HTML element with id "myElement": document.getElementById("myElement").innerHTML = "Hello, dude!";
Submit a link to your code (myy etc).
